meanings.definition: To move faster than someone or something in a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: During the race, the cheetah easily outraced the tortoise.
meanings.sent2: The hare outraced the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outraced the birds to the feeder, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The wind outraced the storm, clearing the sky in minutes.
meanings.sent5: The Olympic sprinter outraced all his competitors, claiming the gold medal.

meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or progress.
meanings.sent1: The new sports car outraced all the other vehicles on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The technology company outraced its competitors in releasing the latest product.
meanings.sent3: The student outraced his classmates in finishing the assignment, earning praise from the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The river outraced the melting snow, flooding the valley sooner than expected.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit outraced the turtle in the race, proving that speed matters.
